meanings.definition: In a manner that shows disgust or discomfort
meanings.sent1: She looked squeamishly at the slimy snail.
meanings.sent2: He turned away squeamishly from the gory scene.
meanings.sent3: The child wrinkled his nose squeamishly at the strange food.
meanings.sent4: The horror movie made her squeamishly cover her eyes.
meanings.sent5: The foul smell made everyone react squeamishly.

meanings.sent1: After the roller coaster ride, she felt squeamishly dizzy.
meanings.sent2: He looked pale and squeamishly asked for a break.
meanings.sent3: The bumpy car ride left him feeling squeamishly unwell.
meanings.sent4: The strong medicine made her feel squeamishly queasy.
meanings.sent5: The spoiled milk smelled squeamishly sour.

meanings.definition: Easily made to feel sick or disgusted
meanings.sent1: The gruesome movie left her squeamishly unsettled.
meanings.sent2: He was squeamishly sensitive to bad smells.
meanings.sent3: The sight of the creepy crawly insect made him squeamishly uneasy.
meanings.sent4: The graphic details in the book made her squeamishly uncomfortable.
meanings.sent5: The slimy texture of the food made him squeamishly repulsed.
